Column Comment.0: COORD ACQUISITION: identifies an assembly of coordinate data that must begrouped together. It should be acquired together at the same time, from the samesource, using the same method and at the same accuracy. Is typically usedtoindicate the level of accuracy of a set of coordinates.
Column Comment.1: ACQUIRED BY BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFER: Unique identifier for thebusiness association who did the coordinate acquisition such as the surveyor,digitizer etc.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: CAPTURE METHOD: The method of capturing coodinate data. For example:Digitizing, Surveying, ...
Column Comment.4: COMPUTE METHOD: The method of computing coordinate values. For example:ATS21 (using bilinear interpolation and the Alberta Township System Version 2.1 gridnodes.)
Column Comment.5: COORDINATE QUALITY: the quality of the coordiante
Column Comment.6: DATA CREATE DATE: The date on which the acquisition data was originally created.
Column Comment.7: DIGITIZED SCALE: For digitized data, the natural scape of the map digitized. i.e.1:63360. Since a map can be enlarged prior to digitizing, the Digitized scale can bedifferent from the source scale.
Column Comment.8: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.9: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.10: HORIZONTAL ACCURACY: Absolute accuracy in real world units of measure for thehorizontal data in the acquisition set.
Column Comment.11: HORIZONTAL ACCURACY ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: the original units ofmeasure used for the Horizontal Accuracy.
Column Comment.12: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should becreated.
Column Comment.13: REMARK: Comments pertaining to the acquisition set.
Column Comment.14: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.15: SOURCE SCALE: for digitized data, the scale of the original map used for digitizing.Note: Source scale represents the scale of the original map, whereas digitzed scalerepresents the scale of the actual map digitized.
Column Comment.16: SURVEY ACCURACY: For survey data, the survey accuracy used. i.e. 1:10000accurate to 1 part in 10000.
Column Comment.17: TRANSFORMATION IDENTIFER: Unique identifier for a transformation betweencoordinate systems.
Column Comment.18: VERTICAL ACCURACY: Absolute accuracy in real world units of measure for thevertical data in the acquisition set.
Column Comment.19: VERTICAL ACCURACY ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: the original units ofmeasure used for the Vertical Accuracy.
Column Comment.20: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.21: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.22: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.23: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.24: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.25: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.26: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
